posts.name: Nik Kruger
posts.cooked:
A couple of weeks ago, I made a post looking for a camcorder with which to film a match at MSC, in an attempt to replicate the look of 2000s, iGeneration FRC. I wasn’t able to locate one, but I was able to use my DSLR to still record a video and then post-produce it in an attempt to recreate the look that I was going for.

I have uploaded it below for your viewing pleasure. Thank you @MOCTA1189 also for linking the tutorial that I used as a basis for the work I did.

(Link if embedding doesn’t work)

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
OMG… I have flashbacks to watching my raw footage from 2013… You nailed the effect! Even going back to watching pre 2010s footage this is definitely well done. The ratio, the shaking, the ref blocking half of the shot… Beautiful work

Edit: did you even match the resolution to what those Tape to Digital cameras were doing at that time? We had “FireWire” transfer cables from some mid 2000s camera to film on even in 2013 so it was not HD but like 480p or i? Still seriously awesome!

posts.name: Siri (she/her)
posts.cooked: This is…perfect. But what a way to tell me I’ve been in FRC so long that alumni need tutorials to mimic my retro feel as a throwback exercise! Shudder.

posts.name: Nik Kruger
posts.cooked: Thanks! I downscaled the sequence to 640x480 (didn’t touch the interlacing so I think it’s 480p). I considered doing 720 but thought that might be anachronistic for the specific era I was going for

posts.name: Jack Somers
posts.cooked: I’m glad I was able to help.

posts.name: sticky_1629
posts.cooked: Sadly this is better than the quality of some of the livestreams from now.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: You made the right decision definitely!

suggested_topics.title: Accessing video of a match that got replayed
suggested_topics.excerpt: Look at the VOD from the Northern Lights Twitch stream on Saturday around 6:45 into the stream. These VODs evaporate after a while, so don’t wait too long to grab the clip you want.
